metadata.title: CVE-2018-20217 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
A Reachable Assertion issue was discovered in the KDC in MIT Kerberos 5 (aka krb5) before 1.17. If an attacker can obtain a krbtgt ticket using an older encryption type (single-DES, triple-DES, or RC4), the attacker can crash the KDC by making an S4U2Self request. It was discovered that Kerberos incorrectly handled certain S4U2Self requests. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-20217` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

krb5-admin-server - 1.17-10
krb5-gss-samples - 1.17-10
krb5-k5tls - 1.17-10
krb5-kdc - 1.17-10
krb5-kdc-ldap - 1.17-10
krb5-kpropd - 1.17-10
krb5-locales - 1.17-10
krb5-multidev - 1.17-10
krb5-otp - 1.17-10
krb5-pkinit - 1.17-10
krb5-user - 1.17-10
libgssapi-krb5-2 - 1.17-10
libgssrpc4 - 1.17-10
libk5crypto3 - 1.17-10
libkadm5clnt-mit12 - 1.17-10
libkadm5srv-mit12 - 1.17-10
libkdb5-10 - 1.17-10
libkrad0 - 1.17-10
libkrb5-3 - 1.17-10
libkrb5support0 - 1.17-10
No subscription required

criterions.comment: krb5 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.17-10').
